speaker: A
text: Hey, man, the crypto market just crashed again. Do you think I should buy the dip or wait it out?

speaker: B
text: You know, that reminds me of a guy I once knew—he was a struggling artist, could barely sell a painting for $10. One day, he decided to paint with his feet just for fun. A wealthy collector saw it, called it "revolutionary," and bought it for $50,000.

speaker: B
text: From then on, he only painted with his feet. He became famous, made millions, and even got invited to give a TED Talk. But then, one day, he tripped over his own paintbrush, sprained both ankles, and could never paint again.

speaker: A
text: …I feel like this has nothing to do with what I asked.

speaker: B
text: Oh, but it does! You see, when he had no expectations, success came to him. When he started planning for it, life humbled him. The lesson? Maybe stop looking at charts and just let fate decide.

speaker: A
text: That’s the worst financial advice I’ve ever heard.
